intro: Pseudocyclosorus canus, commonly known as the pale chain fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its slender, arching fronds that are typically light green in color. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with the rhizome covered in a dense layer of brown, hairy scales. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are arranged in lines along the margins of the fronds. Pseudocyclosorus canus is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
